author: costin
msg: One of the biggest problems with JMX is the way the filter is specified.
When a listener is registered - it can specify a filter, and the filter
will be called before calling the listener.
The problem is - we have no way to optimize the calls. The filter is almost
useless - it's just one extra call that could be done in the listener
itslef.
FixedNotificationFilter is one way around the problem. If we detect a filter
is of this type - we'll know that we can find out what notifications will
be accepted when the listener is added, and avoid calling all filters for all
notifications.
If anyone knows of a better way - please let me know.

author: costin
msg: Implement the introspection as a metadata source.
The abstraction and interface are far from perfect - but it'll get
better.

author: costin
msg: A bit of refactoring of Registry. The metadata source is abstracted -
this will eventually allow us to cache the .ser and other tricks.
The introspection code ( merged from DynamicMBean ) moves to a separate
metadata source.

author: costin
msg: Better error reporting.

author: costin
msg: Added a <modeler> task that will create a BaseModelerMBean wrapping
the real bean. The use is similar with <mlet>, except it wrapps the
modeler around the code.
